channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Pen and Paper Exercises in Machine Learning
item.description: This is a collection of (mostly) pen-and-paper exercises in machine learning.

item.title: Exploiting Temporal Contexts with Strided Transformer for 3D Human Pose Estimation
item.description: The modified VTE is termed as Strided Transformer Encoder (STE), which is built upon the outputs of VTE.

item.title: Multi-Graph Fusion Networks for Urban Region Embedding
item.description: Human mobility data contains rich but abundant information, which yields to the comprehensive region embeddings for cross domain tasks.

item.title: Scaling Autoregressive Models for Content-Rich Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: We present the Pathways Autoregressive Text-to-Image (Parti) model, which generates high-fidelity photorealistic images and supports content-rich synthesis involving complex compositions and world knowledge.

item.title: ProGen2: Exploring the Boundaries of Protein Language Models
item.description: Attention-based models trained on protein sequences have demonstrated incredible success at classification and generation tasks relevant for artificial intelligence-driven protein design.

item.title: EPro-PnP: Generalized End-to-End Probabilistic Perspective-n-Points for Monocular Object Pose Estimation
item.description: The 2D-3D coordinates and corresponding weights are treated as intermediate variables learned by minimizing the KL divergence between the predicted and target pose distribution.

item.title: Ivy: Templated Deep Learning for Inter-Framework Portability
item.description: We introduce Ivy, a templated Deep Learning (DL) framework which abstracts existing DL frameworks.

item.title: BokehMe: When Neural Rendering Meets Classical Rendering
item.description: Based on this formulation, we implement the classical renderer by a scattering-based method and propose a two-stage neural renderer to fix the erroneous areas from the classical renderer.

item.title: Weakly-supervised Video Anomaly Detection with Robust Temporal Feature Magnitude Learning
item.description: To address this issue, we introduce a novel and theoretically sound method, named Robust Temporal Feature Magnitude learning (RTFM), which trains a feature magnitude learning function to effectively recognise the positive instances, substantially improving the robustness of the MIL approach to the negative instances from abnormal videos.

item.title: Free-Form Image Inpainting with Gated Convolution
item.description: We present a generative image inpainting system to complete images with free-form mask and guidance.

item.title: OmniXAI: A Library for Explainable AI
item.description: We introduce OmniXAI (short for Omni eXplainable AI), an open-source Python library of eXplainable AI (XAI), which offers omni-way explainable AI capabilities and various interpretable machine learning techniques to address the pain points of understanding and interpreting the decisions made by machine learning (ML) in practice.

item.title: HM3D-ABO: A Photo-realistic Dataset for Object-centric Multi-view 3D Reconstruction
item.description: Reconstructing 3D objects is an important computer vision task that has wide application in AR/VR.

item.title: Zero-Shot Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Text-to-image generation has traditionally focused on finding better modeling assumptions for training on a fixed dataset.

item.title: OPT: Open Pre-trained Transformer Language Models
item.description: Large language models, which are often trained for hundreds of thousands of compute days, have shown remarkable capabilities for zero- and few-shot learning.

item.title: Transformer in Transformer
item.description: In this paper, we point out that the attention inside these local patches are also essential for building visual transformers with high performance and we explore a new architecture, namely, Transformer iN Transformer (TNT).

item.title: Model Rubikâ€™s Cube: Twisting Resolution, Depth and Width for TinyNets
item.description: To this end, we summarize a tiny formula for downsizing neural architectures through a series of smaller models derived from the EfficientNet-B0 with the FLOPs constraint.

item.title: Vision GNN: An Image is Worth Graph of Nodes
item.description: In this paper, we propose to represent the image as a graph structure and introduce a new Vision GNN (ViG) architecture to extract graph-level feature for visual tasks.

item.title: Augmented Shortcuts for Vision Transformers
item.description: Transformer models have achieved great progress on computer vision tasks recently.

item.title: Elucidating the Design Space of Diffusion-Based Generative Models
item.description: We argue that the theory and practice of diffusion-based generative models are currently unnecessarily convoluted and seek to remedy the situation by presenting a design space that clearly separates the concrete design choices.

item.title: Latent Image Animator: Learning to animate image via latent space navigation
item.description: Deviating from such models, we here introduce Latent Image Animator (LIA), a self-supervised auto-encoder that evades need for structure representation.
